content: pumpkin n i k by angela allen p m u p introduction i n m i love autumn and what s not to love about a a # crocheted pumpkin these can be crocheted in any colour and any size and can even be left out all year as with all my patterns you can amend to suit your needs in terms of width depth and colour so have fun making and adapting the pattern note it is useful to read through all instructions before starting to crochet materials for sample the materials below are those used for the sample in the photo below but there are no rules with this pattern so please play with colour yarn weight and needle size to get your unique pumpkin suggested yarn aran to bulky aran acrylic yarn i used yarn from my and weights are stash which is approximately 190m for the large 208 yards /100g skein pumpkin i used about 35g 67m/73 yards of beige mc and 2g 4m/5 yards of brown cc suggested hook 5mm crochet hook notions toy stuffing about 40g scissors and tapestry needle optional a cinnamon stick or a stick and hot glue gun note you could hold a double knit dk weight yarn double but you will need double the measurements above gauge understanding your own gauge is important more so for fitted garments for this pattern i recommend using the gauge of the yarn you are using 1 abbreviations the instructions are based on uk crochet however this can be easily converted to us chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch st/sts stitch/stitches mc main colour cc contrast colour s double_crochet double_crochet dcblo double_crochet in back loop only note uk double_crochet is us single_crochet pumpkin instructions using your main colour and the recommended hook chain an odd number of stitches for my larger pumpkin i chained 25 the middle one 21 and the small one 17 see picture to right if you would like your pumpkin a little deeper then chain an extra few stitches and crochet a few less row this may take extra yarn than that recommended in the pattern row 1 set-up row row 1 double_crochet in 2nd chain from hook double_crochet in each chain to end ch1 turn you should have one less double crochet than the number of chains you started with row 2-length required row 2 dcblo in each st to end ch1 turn you will now repeat row 2 for the number of row required to give you a rectangle where the length is twice the width note on the last row omit the last ch1 joining and stuffing step 1 bring both short ends together i e the last row and first row together slip_stitch both sides together and finish off leaving a nice long tail for sewing together you should now have a tube step 2 turn seam to inside step 3 tuck the short tail from the initial chain to the inside thread the tapestry needle and catch
